title: Ever since the most recent patch
body:
Ever since the last patch, whenever i play league my ping for whatever reason has started spiking (standard ping when there is nothing wrong is about 20-23) to anything between 250-400 (it sits there for about 5 seconds and drops down, and then will jump again soon after)
The spike in ping is causing my fps to drop which freezes the screen momentarily, leading to many annoying deaths that would never happen.
I've called up my ISP and followed through the many different methods you have set out to resolve issues, but none of them have seemed to have worked and to be completely honest its driving me nuts as it makes league unplayable.

replies.body:
Hey there,

Sorry for the delayed response. I've been rather busy with work lately.

You mentioned you've contacted your ISP, what information have they provided about the issue?

Could you please do the following for me;

* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text.
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/).
* Post back with a link to your WinMTR results (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this) and the url to your ICSI netalyzr results.
